title: Elder-dragons

properties.name: description
properties.value: The elder-dragons are a world creation theory proposed in a book of folklore. The theory links the creation and 'life-force' of Gielinor to the existence of an ancient race of creatures known as the elder-dragons. As long as those dragons lived, the world would continue. Erasing the whole race would result in the 'end of the world'. It has been speculated that elder-dragons could be Dragonkin, who were annihilated by Robert the Strong. Even though Dragonkin are believed to be extinct, survival of a few could explain the continuing of the world after the Dragonkin's slaughter.

content:
The elder-dragons are a world creation theory proposed in a book of folklore. The theory links the creation and 'life-force' of Gielinor to the existence of an ancient race of creatures known as the elder-dragons. As long as those dragons lived, the world would continue. Erasing the whole race would result in the 'end of the world'. It has been speculated that elder-dragons could be Dragonkin, who were annihilated by Robert the Strong. Even though Dragonkin are believed to be extinct, survival of a few could explain the continuing of the world after the Dragonkin's slaughter.

Sceptics claim that the myth of the elder-dragons was invented to cast doubt on claims that this realm was lifeless until the gods first arrived.

The theory of elder-dragons is not widely known, nor is it popular compared to the theory of world creation by Guthix.
rawContent:
The '''elder-dragons''' are a world creation theory proposed in a [[book of folklore]]. The theory links the creation and 'life-force' of [[Gielinor]] to the existence of an ancient race of creatures known as the elder-dragons. As long as those dragons lived, the world would continue. Erasing the whole race would result in the 'end of the world'. It has been speculated that elder-dragons could be [[Dragonkin]], who were annihilated by [[Robert the Strong]]. Even though Dragonkin are believed to be extinct, survival of a few could explain the continuing of the world after the Dragonkin's slaughter.

Sceptics claim that the myth of the elder-dragons was invented to cast doubt on claims that this realm was lifeless until the gods first arrived.

The theory of elder-dragons is not widely known, nor is it popular compared to the theory of world creation by [[Guthix]].
[[Category:Lore]]
